page.title: 01INTRODUCTION, LYNSTED
page.content: The area includes parts of the villages of Rodmersham, Norton & Doddington, & is centred on Lynsted village. The area is set in rural Kent. It is dominated by fields of cherries, hops & sheep, & is sparsely populated though traditionally travellers move into the area in summer & autumn. Recently there have been population changes in the village. The houses are no longer homes for local workers but by people who work outside the village some commuting many miles, or retired people. They live in the village because of its rural beauty and are attracted by the timbered houses. This has led to less of a community life in the area though efforts are made by the church and pub. The little post office struggles to keep open & the local school is at a low ebb.
